name: Cinolazepam
summary: A benzodiazepine hypnotic primarily used for short-term treatment of insomnia in certain European countries.
description: Cinolazepam is a short-acting benzodiazepine with strong sedative and hypnotic properties. It is indicated mainly for the short-term treatment of insomnia, particularly when difficulty initiating sleep is the main complaint. Due to its pharmacokinetic profile, cinolazepam has a rapid onset of action and a relatively short elimination half-life, reducing next-day residual sedation compared to longer-acting benzodiazepines. It is not approved in the United States and is available in select European markets.

metadata.dea_schedule: Not scheduled in US (controlled in other countries)

sections.text: Enhances the effect of GABA at the GABA-A receptor complex, increasing chloride ion influx and producing sedative, hypnotic, anxiolytic, and muscle relaxant effects.

sections.geriatric: Consider 10 mg at bedtime; increased sensitivity to CNS effects
sections.hepatic_impairment: Use with caution; avoid in severe impairment
sections.renal_impairment: No dose adjustment in mild/moderate; caution in severe impairment

items: Tablets: 10 mg, 20 mg (availability varies by country)

sections.text: Rapid onset (within 30 minutes); duration of hypnotic effect approximately 6–8 hours.

other: Risk of tolerance, dependence, and withdrawal with prolonged use
Avoid alcohol and other CNS depressants
Caution in elderly due to fall risk

sections.pregnancy: Category D; avoid unless benefits outweigh risks
sections.lactation: Excreted in breast milk; may cause sedation in infant
sections.geriatrics: Increased sensitivity to sedative effects; use lowest effective dose

sections.text: If used for more than 2–4 weeks, taper gradually over at least 1–2 weeks to avoid withdrawal symptoms.

items: Short-acting profile may reduce next-day sedation compared to longer-acting benzodiazepines
Availability limited to certain European countries
Risk of misuse in patients with history of substance use disorder
